intro: Nautilocalyx urticifolius, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its rough, stinging hairs on its leaves, similar to those found on stinging nettle plants. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a serrated edge, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions in Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
